DOC.brief_title: Continuous Femoral Nerve Blocks : Relative Effects Basal Infusion Bolus Doses Sensory Motor Function
DOC.detailed_description: Specific Aim : Research study test null hypothesis differ delivery method ( continuous basal infusion vs. repeat bolus dos ) provide equal total dose Ropivacaine impact quadriceps muscle strength . These result help define optimal delivery method local anesthetic use continuous peripheral nerve block help guide future research clinically relevant area .
DOC.criteria: 18 year age old willing bilateral femoral perineural catheter place subsequent ropivacaine infusion motor/sensory test 9 hour willing stay overnight UCSD GCRC/CTRI allow dissipation local anesthetic infusion effect follow morning . current daily analgesic use opioid use previous 4 week neuromuscular deficit either femoral nerve and/or quadriceps muscle pregnancy incarceration
